ngrams (Zhang et al., 2015).has description: a bag-of-means method based on TFIDF representations built by choosing the 500,000 most frequent n-grams (up to 5-grams) from the training set and use their corresponding counts as features

small/large word CNN (Zhang et al., 2015.has description: 6 layer word-based convolutional networks, with 256/1024 features at each layer, denoted as small/large, respectively

deep CNN (Conneau et al., 2016).has description: deep convolutional neural networks with 9/17/29 layers

Baselines.from sentence: For document classification, we consider several baseline models: (i) ngrams (Zhang et al., 2015), a bag-of-means method based on TFIDF representations built by choosing the 500,000 most frequent n-grams (up to 5-grams) from the training set and use their corresponding counts as features; (ii) small/large word CNN (Zhang et al., 2015): 6 layer word-based convolutional networks, with 256/1024 features at each layer, denoted as small/large, respectively; (iii) deep CNN (Conneau et al., 2016): deep convolutional neural networks with 9/17/29 layers.
